alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:54AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wabasha, Buffalo and Trempealeau Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Saint Paul to near Kenyon. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mazeppa around 225 AM CDT. Elgin around 240 AM CDT. Plainview around 245 AM CDT. Buffalo and Buffalo City around 300 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Troy, Pioneer Campground, Merrick State Park, Cream, Chimney Rock, Mondovi Airfield, Highway 88 And County O, County Roads F And K K, Rattlesnake Ridge and Tamarack. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 88 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
